title: bump k8s-openapi
body: preparing for a release, thought this ought to be there..

title: update immediate dependencies
body:
cycled this until the outdated list was empty

```sh
cargo outdated -d 1
cargo upgrade somecrate --all
```

and the list was quite large so giving this a try in a pr.
probably means we have a gap here to get automatic prs for dependency updates

title: Expose shortnames of `CustomResource` derive
body:
Fixes https://github.com/stackabletech/issues/issues/93

Discussion at https://discord.com/channels/500028886025895936/685161813675212899/879789729061679204

/cc @maltesander, @lfrancke

title: Add Linkerd to 'real world users'
body:
This change also applies markdownlint, which changes some inconsistent
newlines.

title: Add `restart` utility function.
body:
This PR adds the `restart(name)` function on `Api<K>` where `K` is one of `Deployment`, `DaemonSet`, `StatefulSet` or `ReplicaSet`.
It also adds the complementary method to the `kube` crate.

To implement this functionality, I chose to add `chrono` to the `kube-core` crate, as the alternatives involved lots of code and it's already used in the bigger crate.

This fixes #630 by implementing the necessary functionality.

I hope this PR is acceptable.
Thank you.

title: Infrastructure for awaiting conditions
body:
Fixes #632, replaces #631.

Organization is still up in the air (suggestions?), and I'm not sure that we actually want `await_condition` when we have `watch_object` (https://github.com/kube-rs/kube-rs/issues/632#issuecomment-921404015).

title: rustfmt
body: Changes from `rustfmt +nightly --edition 2018 $(find . -type f -iname *.rs)`.

title: Add Content-Type header to requests with body
body: Closes #626

title: support v1_22 by feature gating crd v1beta1
body:
slightly dodgy because we need to do one of:

- pin k8s-openapi to v1_22 to test legacy features (tested in crd_api)
- pin k8s-openapi to v1_21 and hope the legacy paths work (cant test)
- build multiple k8s-openapi versions in CI

maybe the latter is the best. can pin latest everywhere, and have
examples lag behind as the only place to test legacy?

title: bump k8s-openapi 0.13.0 and revert option unpacking - fixes #581
body: reverts unpacking from #531 while bumping k8s-openapi for https://github.com/Arnavion/k8s-openapi/releases/tag/v0.13.0

title: fix release script generator and offload work to a script - fixes #601
body:
creates a script dedicated for what the release action was doing (for some reason it didn't like my indent, and it's awkward to have that much shell in there anyway).

to avoid shell script sprawl, this also adds a scripts dir for these things, and standardises on naming.

[think it's fine to depend on jq in the action](https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments/blob/72813adbe7adf46b4bcc2514221de8f937d4d7ea/images/linux/scripts/base/apt.sh)

title: File config serialization should skip None values
body:
I would like to round trip the kube config file and not introduce a bunch of `value: ~` for None values. This instructs serde to skip serializing None values.

Closes #612.

title: Add cargo-deny, clippy and rustfmt to CI - try #2
body:
The previous PR #607 had issues (I couldn't get DCO right) so I created a new one.

This adds cargo-deny (for license checks and security advisories), rustfmt and clippy to the CI run for Pull Requests

title: Add a dependabot configuration
body:
I'm not sure if you're even interested in this but it's been useful for us.
Dependabot automatically checks for dependency updates for cargo and github actions (looking at the workflows I already see what it's going to complain about :) )

I've set the interval to weekly, daily is a bit too annyoing :)
I also added a label that doesn't exist yet so if you like the idea clux needs to add the label.

If you don't want dependabot I'm happy to close the PR again.

title: Add HasSpec and HasStatus traits
body:
These traits are automatically derived (if possible) in kube-derive.

I've put the traits in the object module for now because it kinda fits there but I don't really care. I can move them into their own or somewhere else.

This PR is still a draft as it isn't fully cleaned up yet but the API itself should be reviewable already (the traits and their signatures).
I'm very unsure about the correct signature for the `_mut` methods.

title: Changelog fix: Controller::owns now restricts the DynamicType
body:
This can lead to errors like this:

```
error[E0271]: type mismatch resolving `<Child as kube::Resource>::DynamicType == ()`
   --> src/controller.rs:235:53
    |
235 |         self.kube_controller = self.kube_controller.owns(api, lp);
    |                                                     ^^^^ expected associated type, found `()`
    |
    = note: expected associated type `<Child as kube::Resource>::DynamicType`
                     found unit type `()`
help: consider constraining the associated type `<Child as kube::Resource>::DynamicType` to `()`
    |
232 |         Child: Clone + Debug + Resource<DynamicType = ()> + DeserializeOwned + Send + 'static,
    |                                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
error: aborting due to previous error

```

We had a wrapper around `owns` with this signature:

```
    pub fn owns<Child>(mut self, api: Api<Child>, lp: ListParams) -> Self
    where
        Child: Clone + Debug + Resource + DeserializeOwned + Send + 'static,
        <Child as Resource>::DynamicType: Clone + Debug + Eq + Hash,
```

title: rebrand clux/kube-rs to kube-rs/kube-rs
body:
various `sed -i "s/clux\/kube\-rs/kube-rs\/kube-rs/g" *` invocations

not sure how long the auto-redirect form github will last.

title: Contributing.md and DCO
body: Based on simpler requirements and discussion after https://github.com/kube-rs/kube-rs/issues/585#issuecomment-892070891

title: Ensure that any span emitted in `error_policy` is a child span of the root span for the respective reconciliation run.
body: This make it easier to troubleshoot and allows users to delegate most of the logging to `error_policy` rather than having to do it twice to get the error info attached to the root span.

title: Updated URL for the Krustlet repo in the readme
body:
The Krustlet repository was just moved to an org of its own in preparation of being donated to the CNCF. 
This updates the link in the Readme to reflect the new location.

title: use cluster dns to reach apiserver for rustls - for #587
body: ~~untested~~ based on suggestion in #587 to fix #153

title: cncf code of conduct
body: taken from helm. hotlinks to [cncf coc](https://github.com/cncf/foundation/blob/master/code-of-conduct.md). seems best practice to just link here, and use lowercase naming (both helm and kubernetes/client-go does this)

title: Serialize and Deserialize implementations for ApiResource
body: Would be great to have these very convenient traits implemented for `ApiResource`.

title: Adds a `CustomResourceExt::crd_name()` function
body:
This information can also be gathered from `ApiResource` but not everything that is an `ApiResource` is also a CRD so I believe it makes sense to add a convenience method here.
This information can also be gathered from `CustomResourceExt::crd().name()` but this is relatively expensive to create.
